doc.str: The invention is a process for the purification of ethanol. In one embodiment the process includes boiling a degassed beer feed (106) in a pre-boiler (110) to provide a vapor by-pass fraction (112) that by-passes the conventional beer column and is fed into the rectifier column (124). The process allows free capacity in the rectifier column of new or established plants to be filled by ethanol-water vapor and/or condensate streams that do not originate from the beer column.

Michael R. Ladisch et al., Cornmeal Adsorber for Dehydrating Ethanol Vapors, I&EC Process Design & Development, 1984, vol. 23:437. cited by other . | P. W. Madson et al., Fuel Ethanol Production in Fuel Alcohol Textbook, Alltech Inc., 1999, Chapter 17, pp. 257-268. cited by other . | S. R. Garg et al., Molecular Sieve Dehydration Cycle for High Water Content Streams, CEP, Apr. 1983, pp. 60-65. cited by other .
